programme.title: Uncanny
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Liam, who grew up on a remote farm near Bury. His childhood was marred by ghostly sightings of a little boy and an oppressive presence, making him so terrified that, even as an adult, he refused to go upstairs in his house alone.

programme.title: Uncanny: Post Mortem
programme.desc: Danny Robins takes a deeper dive into the haunting of Hollymount Farm with new evidence, leads and expert insights, and `Ghosts' actor Kiell Smith-Bynoe shares his take on the case.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: North West England: Mains and Dessert
programme.desc: The remaining three chefs from north west England compete over mains and desserts inspired by the Olympic and Paralympic Games. They serve a unique take on the brief celebrating great Britons of the past for a banquet at historic Blenheim Palace.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.desc: Four more gritty Contenders take on the Gladiators in five brutal events before going head-to-head in the gruelling Eliminator. Who has the will and the skill to conquer the infamous Travelator and win a place in the quarter-finals?

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In between marvelling at the countryside on offer in east Devon, Nicki Chapman goes house hunting with a couple of Londoners. Nicki meets a pair of former city slickers who have gone back to traditional farming methods on their 100-acre property.

programme.title: The Repair Shop: On the Road
programme.desc: Dom and plaster expert Rich try to preserve some World War II Polish art before it is lost forever. Meanwhile, David Burville repairs a clockwork ship, and Will gets to grips with shinty.

programme.title: Alison Hammond's Florida Unpacked
programme.desc: Alison and Aidan show how to live the American dream on wheels, hitting the road in a camper van to explore Silver Springs State Park. Renting a motorhome abroad might sound like a recipe for chaos, but Alison shows how it can be surprisingly simple.

programme.title: Joanna Page's Wild Life
programme.desc: Actor Joanna Page continues her training at a local wildlife rescue centre, helping with the rehabilitation and release of a jackdaw, a wood mouse and a tiny vole.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: The game show that mixes general knowledge quizzing and bowling.

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being in control is everything. Who will emerge as the Boss and walk away with the cash? Only the strongest players will survive the game.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Looking at the remote South Pacific islands. Their extraordinary isolation has created some of the most curious, surprising and precarious examples of life found anywhere on Earth, from giant crabs that tear open coconuts to flesh-eating caterpillars that impale their prey on dagger-like claws. Human culture is different, too.

programme.title: Earth's Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: The spring season brings a burst of new life, but as soon as the air starts to warm, it's a race to wake up and get ahead of everyone else. For many, it's the perfect time to find a mate and raise babies, but spring is also about rushing to make the most of the opportunities this busy season brings.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team are at Penrhyn Castle in North Wales. Antiques expert Claire Rawle uncovers a pristine vintage Barbie doll, and Adam Partridge finds a 300-year-old map of the area. Paul Martin finds an ice axe that may have been used to scale Mount Everest.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Karen Hauer, Storm Huntley, Joe Marler and Tom Read Wilson take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Alison Hammond's Florida Unpacked
programme.desc: Alison and Aidan hop on a Key West tour train to cruise to Duval Street, join a shoreline cleanup, and cap off their day with the iconic sunset at Mallory Square.

programme.title: Yellowstone: Wildest Winter to Blazing Summer
programme.desc: It is summer and the Yellowstone beavers have a new challenge. Will the young survive as the river dries up and the colony is forced to move home? As food becomes scarce, wolves have a surprising strategy to keep their pups fed and grizzly bears are unexpected visitors on a cowboy ranch.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Uncanny
programme.desc: Danny Robins meets Sybil, the manager of a shop where multiple staff witnessed the terrifying presence of a man who appeared to be watching their every move.

programme.title: Uncanny: Post Mortem
programme.desc: Danny Robins takes a deeper dive into the case of The Charity Shop Poltergeist with new evidence, leads and insights, and celebrity expert Meera Syal gives her take on the case.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Free Solo
programme.desc: Professional rock climber Alex Honnold attempts to conquer the first free solo climb of famed El Capitan's 900-metre vertical rock face at Yosemite National Park.

programme.title: Free Solo
programme.desc: Professional rock climber Alex Honnold attempts to conquer the first free solo climb of famed El Capitan's 900-metre vertical rock face at Yosemite National Park.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Rewiring Britain: The Race to Go Green
programme.desc: Huge clean energy projects are stirring anger across Britain. The government says new pylons, solar plants, wind turbines and electricity substations are essential to meet its bold plan to decarbonise the country's electricity by 2030.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's judging day, and only one chef can go through to represent north west England. Campaigner Margaret Aspinall helps decide the winner from the two remaining chefs.

programme.title: SAS Rogue Heroes
programme.desc: The SAS return to Britain and are given some time to decompress from the events in Italy. Bill is shocked to hear about the intended role for the SAS in the invasion of France.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels search for Duggee. They find someone who looks like Enid, but larger. It is Duggee with his face painted to resemble Enid. Fascinated, the Squirrels ask Duggee to paint their faces too.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters fly to the rescue in Japan, as Glitch gets up to his usual monkey business.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Follows the many adventures of a boy, a girl, a dog, a cat, a mouse, and a piece of cheese as they come together to live under one roof.

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: The kids engage in a battle with Mrs Jorgensen, a super poltergeist.

programme.title: Pok√©mon Horizons: The Series
programme.sub-title: Transform! Hero of the Seas, Palafin
programme.desc: During a day at the beach, Liko and Roy meet a Pok√©mon with a superhero secret.

programme.title: Pickle Storm
programme.desc: Pickle faces a new challenge on her first day at school. Despite Mia's help, Pickle struggles to fit in. Her magic causes problems, and an unusual creature appears in the classroom.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve heads to Suriname, a country with more forest than anywhere else on Earth. He kayaks upriver in search of some deadly wildlife.

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.sub-title: Competition Winners Reveal with HRH Prince William
programme.desc: It's time to meet the winners of the `Blue Peter Earthshot' competition!

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Odette
programme.desc: The true story of one of the Allies' most courageous spies, Odette Churchill, who was captured by the Gestapo and subjected to torture in an attempt to make her betray her companions.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Nigella delivers a serving of feelgood food, sharing the origins of some of her latest recipe ideas and revealing just how and why they came into being. There is a beautiful bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil, a recipe that was inspired by Nigella's holiday in Thailand.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Nigella delivers a serving of feelgood food, sharing the origins of some of her latest recipe ideas and revealing just how and why they came into being. There is a beautiful bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil, a recipe that was inspired by Nigella's holiday in Thailand.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Raymond uses two wonderfully seasonal ingredients - game and mushrooms. His first recipe is a delicate cep mushroom tortellini using fresh pasta. He follows this up with a French version of a pasty called a pithivier filled with a rich mix of pheasant, chestnuts and dried fruits.

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott has picked dishes influenced by the exciting cuisine of some the world's most exotic places. The menu includes tapas from James Martin, Paul Hollywood's tortilla tower, a Jamaican ginger cake from the Hairy Bikers and Ainsley's own delicious jerk pork dish.

programme.title: Doctor Zhivago
programme.desc: Epic adaptation of Boris Pasternak's Nobel Prize-winning novel about a Russian doctor and poet, set over three decades in the early part of the 20th century. Made an enemy of the state by the revolution because of his writing, Zhivago seeks solace with the woman brought into his life by the First World War.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin is at the Watts Gallery in the heart of the Surrey countryside with experts David Harper and Thomas Plant. David uncovers a collection of British film and TV memorabilia and Thomas is thrilled by some French cameo glass. Also, Paul Martin is on the trail of martians in Woking: the setting for HG Wells's sci-fi novel `The War Of The Worlds'.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: At Chirk Castle, a full-length portrait of a servant from the 18th century reveals its secrets. Plus, in Oxburgh Hall, on the edge of the Norfolk fenlands, two rare hidden treasures are brought back into the light.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: At Chirk Castle, a full-length portrait of a servant from the 18th century reveals its secrets. Plus, in Oxburgh Hall, on the edge of the Norfolk fenlands, two rare hidden treasures are brought back into the light.

programme.title: The Balkans: Europe's Forgotten Frontier
programme.desc: The BBC's Europe editor, Katya Adler, travels to Croatia, Bosnia, and Albania. Thirty years since the Yugoslav wars of independence, she discovers a beautiful region undergoing rapid change.

programme.title: Liz Bonnin's Wild Caribbean
programme.desc: Liz joins residents of Mayreau in repairing their vibrant coral after it was damaged by disease, helps protect the tiny Union Island gecko, and relives one of her most magnificent wildlife encounters.

programme.title: Heartbreakers at the BBC
programme.desc: Aretha Franklin's 'Don't Play That Song' is a message that's thankfully ignored in this collection of tracks with tears, with some of music's biggest stars pouring their hearts out in a selection of classic performances from the BBC's archives. Alongside the Queen of Soul are a diverse range of artists, including Dolly Parton, the Arctic Monkeys, One Direction, Boyz II Men and George Michael - all guaranteeing an irresistible musical mix of pleasure and pain.

programme.title: Love Songs at the BBC: Volume 3
programme.desc: This third volume of romantic hits from the BBC archives includes classic tracks from the 70s, 80s and 90s, with songs from likes of The Carpenters, The Three Degrees, Simply Red, Meatloaf and Sting.

programme.title: Heartbreakers at the BBC
programme.desc: More of the greatest sad songs ever, featuring classic tracks from the likes of Sade, the Righteous Brothers, Toni Braxton, Lewis Capaldi and many more stars who broke the charts whilst also breaking hearts.

programme.title: Love Songs at the BBC: Volume 2
programme.desc: A stunning selection of perfect performances of love songs from the BBC's music archives, including the sounds of Nat King Cole, Shania Twain, Billy Joel, Ed Sheeran and many, many more.
